check minute 10+ on lecture 4 about DNA sequence 

```{r}
# generating a random DNA sequence 
nucleotide=c("A", "T", "G", "C")

dna = sample(nucleotide, 10, replace = TRUE)
dna

length1 = length(dna)
print(length1)

# Method 1 - Using for loop and checking individual positions
# initializing counters
a=0; t=0; g=0; c=0
dna
#Calculating A,T,G,C
for (i in 1:length1)
{
  if(dna[i]=="A"){a=a+1}
  if(dna[i]=="T"){t=t+1}
  if(dna[i]=="G"){g=g+1}
  if(dna[i]=="C"){c=c+1}
}

cat("A,T,G,C ", a,t,g,c)

#Calculate the GC content 
gc=((g+c)/length1)*100

print(c("GC content =", gc))
```

Using libraries instead of loops 

```{r}
library(stringr)

dna=paste(dna, collapse="")
print(dna)

a=str_count(dna, "A")
t=str_count(dna, "T")
g=str_count(dna, "G")
c=str_count(dna, "C")

cat("A, T, G, C",a, t, g, c)
```
